claim: Recombinant HA antigens produced using BEVS have been shown to induce significantly higher levels of broadly cross-reactive antibodies against highly conserved regions of HA compared with egg-derived vaccines.
explanation: Flow diagram of a study cohort (age ≥18 years) showing initial N=18,467, exclusions (n=3,264), analyzable cohort (N=15,203), and breakdown into controls (N=13,385) and influenza cases (N=1,868). Both controls and cases are subdivided by vaccine type: recombinant quadrivalent influenza vaccine (RIV4), standard-dose quadrivalent IIV4 (SD-IIV4), high-dose/adjuvanted IIV4 (HD-IIV4 + Adj-IIV), and unvaccinated. The figure presents participant flow and group sizes by vaccine type but contains no data on antibody levels or cross-reactivity. It does not support the claim regarding broadly cross-reactive antibody induction by BEVS-derived recombinant HA antigens compared with egg-derived vaccines. Note: None
